column5: 4th time out this spring on Lake Ontario this morning...Finally managed to hook a couple of spring Kings.
Great job out there!  The lake looked like glass out there and the fish had some great colours to them.  Congrats on a successful day!
Great stuff Dax... gotta do something to fill the time 'till June ! lol
Nice work Dax - it was tough sledding out there today. Would you mind sharing some details? (PM me if you prefer).  Thanks!

Rod, I'm not an experienced enough Salmon guy to have any secrets! Both fish came off the rigger on a NK spoon(blue/white), 50 feet down and about 40 feet back. We were in 75-110 fow right off the canal. Fished from 7am till 1030am, both fish were about 930-945 back to back. marked lots of bait/hooks in that same area, nothing anywhere else. I was running 2 riggers with spoons, and 2 Dipseys on the 3 setting back about 75-100 feet, one with a Spin Doc & fly, the other with a spoon. Dipseys didn't get a sniff...
Wow, fantastic fish.  Way to go.  Joey
Thanks Dax - looks like you made a good call! If I can be of any assistance - count me in.  :-)
That first one is a whale.  Nice shooting, Dax.  BTW, how cool is it to have a name like that?
Nice job !!!!...great looking spring kings for sure,  man they sure fight hard in that ice cold water too !!!    cheers
Nice fish,,,soon i'll be hittin' the kings myself,,,definatly a great fight!
I agree, that first one is good-sized for this time of year.  19-20 lbs is my guess...
